page.title: 19AGRICULTURAL SHOW
page.content: {EVENTS (AGRICULTURAL SHOW) The Holm{Show }started in 1885. It stopped in 1913 because of the first world war. It restarted in 1920, it stopped again in 1936 for the second world war and restarted in 1948 as the present Holm{Show.}It continued till the present day apart from two times due to foot and mouth disease. The main{events}are the{agricultural {events,}such as{sheep competitions. There are{sheep competions}for black faced{sheep,}grey faced {sheep, cheviot{sheep,}swale dale{sheep,}blue faced leiceter and jacobs{sheep. Some{sheep}in the holm show in the 50s and 60s wore make-up.The black faced{sheep}were sometimes brown faced so the farmer put black make up on. The{sheep}are judged as if they were straight of the hill.
